text: Sequential development of structural and functional alterations in T cells from tumor-bearing mice .

The TCR alpha beta or -gamma delta chains bind the peptide ligand , whereas the associated <extra_id_0> CD3 delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> epsilon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TCR zeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunits couple the TCR to intracellular signal transduction components .
Recently , several groups have described marked alterations in signal transduction elements in T cells from cancer patients or in mice bearing tumor for a few weeks ( > 26 days ) .
The sequence in which these alterations develop is unknown .

The aim of this study was to explore the kinetics of the development of alterations in signal transduction molecules ( <extra_id_0> TCR zeta chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NF kappaB family proteins , and <extra_id_0> tyrosine kinase p56(lck) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in mice bearing MC38 colon adenocarcinoma .

The results demonstrate that alterations in NF kappaB family proteins , specifically the failure of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> translocation to the nucleus , occur earlier and more frequently than the decrease in zeta-chain .
